page.title: 12FARMING IN THE CLAYPOLE AREA
page.content: There are sixteen farms of various sizes in our block. Two of them have small flocks of sheep and some others a secondary interest in pigs. There is one dairy farm and one pig farm in Claypole. Half of the farmers live in the villages and the other half in outlying farmsteads. Farm animals, with the exception of the one dairy herd, are rarely seen in the village street, a far cry from yesteryear. More common sights are huge tractors carrying various labour saving implements and, during late summer, the combine harvester. Owing to the mechinisation in farming methods few people are required to work on the land so the villages, especially Claypole, have become dormitory areas serving Newark.
